articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: Wall Street fell on Wednesday after stronger-than-expected services sector data fueled concerns of sticky inflation and interest rates staying higher for longer, while a drop in shares of Apple further weighed down the indexes.
articles.title: Wall St slides as services data stokes inflation worries, Apple drags

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department should end all technology exports to Huawei and China's top semiconductor firm following the discovery of new chips in Huawei phones that may violate trade restrictions, the chair of the House of Representatives' committee on China said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US lawmaker calls for ending Huawei, SMIC exports after chip breakthrough

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The office of U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai on Wednesday further extended China "Section 301" tariff exclusions on 352 Chinese import and 77 COVID-19-related categories till Dec. 31 that were set to expire on Sept. 30.
articles.title: US extends tariff exclusions on some Chinese categories till end of 2023

articles.author: Anirban Sen, Abigail Summerville
articles.description: Kroger Co (KR.N) and Albertsons Cos Inc (ACI.N) are nearing a deal they hope will secure U.S. regulatory clearance for their proposed $24.5 billion merger, by selling more than 400 grocery stores to C&S Wholesale Grocers for nearly $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Kroger, Albertsons plan to offload over 400 stores for close to $2 billion, sources say

articles.author: Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: Oil prices ticked up on Thursday, as markets worried about a supply shortage after Saudi Arabia and Russia extended their voluntary supply cuts to the end of the year.
articles.title: Oil prices edge higher on supply woes as Saudi, Russia extend output cuts

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United Auto Workers union on Wednesday plans to make a labor contract counterproposal on economic issues to Ford Motor (F.N), a source told Reuters.
articles.title: UAW plans to make contract counteroffer to Ford - source

articles.author: Helen Coster, Samrhitha A
articles.description: Comcast (CMCSA.O) has moved up the date for the sale or purchase of its remaining stake in Hulu to Disney (DIS.N) to Sept. 30 this year, CEO Brian Roberts said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Comcast moves up date for Hulu deal with Disney to Sept 30, 2023

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nichola Groom
articles.description: The U.S. Interior Department on Wednesday will announce the cancellation of oil and gas leases in a federal wildlife refuge that were bought by an Alaska state development agency in 2021, according to sources briefed on the matter.
articles.title: Biden administration to announce cancellation of Alaska wildlife drilling leases -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A reported Russian attack on a city in eastern Ukraine that killed at least 16 people overshadowed a visit on Wednesday by U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken to offer Kyiv support for its counteroffensive against Russia's invasion forces.
articles.title: Deadly market attack in Ukraine overshadows visit by Blinken

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove
articles.description: Moderna (MRNA.O) and rival Pfizer (PFE.N) on Wednesday said their updated COVID-19 vaccines generated strong responses in testing against the highly mutated BA.2.86 subvariant of the coronavirus that has raised fears of a resurgence of infections.
articles.title: Moderna, Pfizer say updated COVID shots generate strong response vs newer variant
